definition: harmonious/to mediate/to reconcile/to compromise/mediation/to mix/to blend/blended/to season/seasoning/to placate
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

sentences.english: The takings clause mediates between the police power and the eminent domain power.
sentences.chinese: 征收条款是在警察权有偿取得财产权的调和。

sentences.english: Filling is stuffing and fixing with slurry mixture of raw lacquer and fine gray gypsum.
sentences.chinese: 补灰就是用生漆和细石膏调和成浆状举办填密和修补。

sentences.english: Mix cucumber juice with milk and use it instead of a cleanser.
sentences.chinese: 将黄瓜汁与牛奶调和成洁面乳。

sentences.english: To survive as individuals, we'll have to learn to temper our trust.
sentences.chinese: 作为个体想要生存，我们就必须学会调和我们的信任。

sentences.english: Stir in the rice and boil until just done, about 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 一边加入大米一边调和直到煮沸，大约10分钟。

sentences.english: In terms of honor, l stand aloof and will no reconcilement .
sentences.chinese: 雷为了荣誉，我的立场不会变，我们不可能调和。

sentences.english: He sees life as continually, always already mediated by language.
sentences.chinese: 他将人生看作是连续的，永远可被语言调和。

sentences.english: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
sentences.chinese: 拿没药调和的酒给耶稣，他却不受。

sentences.english: But an time of reconciliation lies ahead.
sentences.chinese: 但要调和的时间摆在前面。

sentences.english: Maybe you have an irreconcilable personality difference with your manager.
sentences.chinese: 也许你同你的上司有不可调和的性格差异。

sentences.english: As this plane was hit by electrical frequencies, the vibration of disharmony resulted.
sentences.chinese: 当此层面被电性频率撞击，不调和的振动发生。

sentences.english: In this paper a estimate of the harmonious chromatic number of a complete 5-ary tree was given.
sentences.chinese: 本文给出了五元完全树的调和着色数的比较好的估计。

sentences.english: They dream of an unmediated relationship between experience and the word.
sentences.chinese: 他们梦想着经验与世界，有一种未经调和的关系。

sentences.english: When mixed with water, the powder would provide sustainable meals .
sentences.chinese: 加水调和后，这种狗食粉将可提供丰富的餐食。

sentences.english: Great hatred does not lend itself to reconciliation.
Mathematically, it is the solution of a harmonic inward continuation problem.
sentences.chinese: 数学上，它是调和函数内向连续问题。

definition: Zhonghe or Chungho city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to water down/to play down/to trivialize/to weaken/to become dull with time/to desalinate/desalination
